docs.title: ElectroCat ⚡
docs.text:
ElectroCat (or ecat) is a Python toolkit for analyzing molecular and surface electrocatalysts under explicit solvation and ionic conditions.

Whether you're studying molecular catalysts, extended surfaces, or hybrid systems, ElectroCat provides flexible tools to decode complex electrochemical environments with atomistic resolution.

👉 Dive into the Installation Guide or explore the User Guide to get started.

docs.title: Installation 🔧
docs.text: ElectroCat is tested with python 3.12.9 and works well inside a conda or uv environment.

docs.title: 2. Create dev environment
docs.text:
Makefile is provided to create a nested Conda + uv environment for development.

make create-conda
conda activate ecat
make setup-dev

docs.title: 3. Build the docs
docs.text:
To build the documentation, we make use of mkdocs and mkdocs-material. Documentation will be live at http://localhost:8000

make docs-serve
